meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be modified or adjusted.
meanings.sent1: The modulability of the toy allowed children to build various structures.
meanings.sent2: Software developers appreciate the modulability of the code, making it easy to update.
meanings.sent3: The modulability of the cake recipe led to a delicious baking experiment.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had a modulability that transformed ordinary ideas into extraordinary innovations.
meanings.sent5: The modulability of the fabric made it perfect for versatile clothing designs.

meanings.definition: The ability to be changed or adapted.
meanings.sent1: The modulability of the furniture allowed for easy rearrangement in the room.
meanings.sent2: The modulability of the lesson plan made it simple to adjust for different student needs.
meanings.sent3: His modulability in trying new foods surprised his friends at the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The modulability of her voice made her a versatile singer in different music genres.
meanings.sent5: The modulability of the puzzle design made it challenging yet enjoyable to solve.
